001// SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-3.0-or-later
002
003package es.uvigo.esei.sing.textproc.step.corenlpknowledgebasepopulation.xml.definition;
004
005import java.util.regex.Pattern;
006
007import javax.xml.bind.annotation.XmlRootElement;
008
009import org.apache.jena.riot.Lang;
010
011import es.uvigo.esei.sing.textproc.step.xml.definition.AbstractProcessingStepParameter;
012
013/**
014 * Parameter for specifying the path of the file that a knowledge base will be
015 * exported to, along with its format.
016 * <p>
017 * For the available export formats, see the Apache Jena {@link Lang} class, and
018 * the Apache Jena documentation in general.
019 * </p>
020 *
021 * @author Alejandro González García
022 */
023@XmlRootElement(name = "knowledgeBaseExportFile")
024public final class KnowledgeBaseExportFileProcessingStepParameter extends AbstractProcessingStepParameter {
025        private static final char TOKEN_SEPARATOR = ',';
026        private static final int NUMBER_OF_TOKENS = 2;
027
028        private static final String TOKEN_SEPARATOR_REGEX = Pattern.quote(
029                String.valueOf(TOKEN_SEPARATOR)
030        );
031
032        /**
033         * Checks whether the specified value is valid for this processing step
034         * parameter.
035         *
036         * @param value The value to check.
037         * @return True if and only if the value is valid, false otherwise.
038         */
039        public static boolean isValid(final String value) {
040                boolean valid = value != null;
041
042                if (valid) {
043                        final String strippedValue = value.strip();
044                        valid = !strippedValue.isEmpty();
045
046                        if (valid) {
047                                final String[] splittedValue = strippedValue.split(TOKEN_SEPARATOR_REGEX, NUMBER_OF_TOKENS);
048                                valid = splittedValue.length == NUMBER_OF_TOKENS;
049
050                                for (int i = 0; i < NUMBER_OF_TOKENS && valid; ++i) {
051                                        valid = !splittedValue[i].isBlank();
052                                }
053                        }
054                }
055
056                return valid;
057        }
058
059        /**
060         * Retrieves the path component of a valid value for this processing step
061         * parameter.
062         *
063         * @param value The value for this processing step parameter.
064         * @return The path component of this value, that represents the path to the
065         *         exported knowledge base.
066         * @throws IllegalArgumentException If {@code value} is not valid.
067         */
068        public static String getPathFromValue(final String value) {
069                if (!isValid(value)) {
070                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("The value is not valid");
071                }
072
073                return getValueToken(value, 0);
074        }
075
076        /**
077         * Retrieves the format component of a valid value for this processing step
078         * parameter.
079         *
080         * @param value The value for this processing step parameter.
081         * @return The path component of this value, that represents the format of the
082         *         exported knowledge base file. For available formats, see the Apache
083         *         Jena {@link Lang} class.
084         * @throws IllegalArgumentException If {@code value} is not valid.
085         */
086        public static String getFormatFromValue(final String value) {
087                if (!isValid(value)) {
088                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("The value is not valid");
089                }
090
091                return getValueToken(value, 1);
092        }
093
094        /**
095         * Returns a token of a value that is in the specified zero-based position, so
096         * the first token has index 0, the second 1, and so on. The value is assumed to
097         * be valid, as per {@link #isValid(String)}.
098         *
099         * @param value The value that contains the token to get.
100         * @param index The index of the token.
101         * @return The non-null value of the token.
102         * @throws IllegalArgumentException If the index is invalid.
103         */
104        private static String getValueToken(
105                final String value, final int index
106        ) {
107                return getValueToken(value, index, NUMBER_OF_TOKENS);
108        }
109
110        /**
111         * Returns a token of a value that is in the specified zero-based position, so
112         * the first token has index 0, the second 1, and so on. The value is assumed to
113         * be valid, as per {@link #isValid(String)}.
114         *
115         * @param value     The value that contains the token to get.
116         * @param index     The index of the token.
117         * @param maxTokens The maximum number of tokens that the value will be split
118         *                  to.
119         * @return The non-null value of the token.
120         * @throws IllegalArgumentException If the index is invalid.
121         */
122        private static String getValueToken(
123                final String value, final int index, final int maxTokens
124        ) {
125                if (index < 0 || index >= NUMBER_OF_TOKENS) {
126                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("The index points to an inexistent token");
127                }
128
129                return value.strip().split(TOKEN_SEPARATOR_REGEX, maxTokens)[index];
130        }
131}
